Title: Virtual Pet Simulator Game Using Augmented Reality on Android Platform
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chahyana, J., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Augmented reality is one of the interactive technologies that can be used to help the user to easily interact with the system. The game application called AR Virtual Pet Simulator is a simulator game which uses Augmented Reality technology to display a virtual pet, for the purpose of enhancing the users' experience. Users can also interact by using application to understand the daily behaviours of pets. Application development methods are carried out starting from gathering requirements, design, implementation, to testing and evaluation. Results from the end evaluation shows that the application was well-liked by users and it could help users in knowing how to take care of pets, but the experience of using the application is not the same as having a pet in the real world. Conclusion gathered from the research is that applications with virtual pets are not able to entirely replace real pets but are able to provide knowledge on taking care of pets. Where users cannot interact directly with pets. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Augmented reality; Petroleum reservoir evaluation; Simulators; User experience; Android platforms; Application development; Augmented reality technology; Interactive technology; Real-world; Testing and evaluation; Users' experiences; Virtual reality

Authors: Yesmaya V., Ronald A., Hidajat M.
Title: Property exhibition decision support system based on web application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ronald, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Complexity in finding property on property exhibition which consider many related constraints is quite high. Customers need to spend much time to analyse the right property to buy depends on their constraints whether salary, distance to work, facility, etc. According to the problem, this research will collect the information from customer on property exhibition to find out the constraint. Also, this research will focus on design and analyses the decision support system for property exhibition. Software development life cycle that will be used is scrum which is divided into several processes like backlog, sprints, scrum meetings, and demos. The result of this research is a web application that help customer to collect the information of the property according to their constraints. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Decision support system; Property exhibition; Scrum
References: Ningrong, L., Seung, K.M., A Decision Support System for market-driven product positioning and design (2015) Decision Support Systems, 69, pp. 82-91; George, S., Dimitrios, K., Athanasios, V., Marketing decision support using Artificial Intelligence and Knowledge Modeling: application to tourist destination management (2014) International Confenrence on Strategic Innovative Marketing, 175, pp. 106-113; Sauter, V.L., Decision Support Systems for Business Intelligence (2011) New Jersey. Authors: Ronald A., Yesmaya V., Danaparamita M.
Title: Personal security tracking based on android and web application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ronald, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, the frequency of abduction is increasing significantly. Information technology provide many social media which is causing the leaked of personal information where abductor can find out the information. Using social media, people can share location, life event, and anything related about their life event, these become the useful information for the abductor. To anticipate this, a lot of personal tracking device is developed, but the response is too late. Because, the family or relative of the victims will notice that abduction had happen after the victim is lost. According to the problem, this research will focus on develop the personal tracking device which trigger by the victims who own the phone based on android and web application. Whenever the abduction happens, the victim just need to click the button and the system will send a message to the relatives and family in their contact also trigger the notification to the local security. Software development life cycle that will be used is scrum which is divided into several processes like backlog, sprints, scrum meetings, and demos. The result of this research is android application for user and web application for managing application. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Android application; Decision support system; Tracking application; Web application
References: Kinage, R., Kumari, J., Zalke, P., Kulkarni, M., Mobile Tracking Application (2013) International Journal of Innovative Research in Science, Engineering and Technology, 2 (3), pp. 617-623; Shirin, S., Dipina, D.B., Surekha, M.V., Mobile Tracker (2016) International Journal on Cybernetics and Informatics, 5 (2), pp. 213-219; Abhijeet, T., Ahemad, T., Ravindra, S., Pranay, D., Sumit, H., Mobile Tracking Application for Locating Friends using LBS (2013) International Journal of Innovative Research in Computer and Communication Engineering, 1 (2), pp. 303-308; Abha, D., Hardik, S., Krishna, S., Global Positioning System for Object Tracking (2015) International of Computer Application, 109 (8), pp. 40-45; Pressman, R.S., Maxim, B.R., (2010) Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach, , Eighth Edition. Authors: Adrianto D., Hidajat M., Yesmaya V.
Title: Augmented reality using Vuforia for marketing residence
Source title: 2016 1st International Conference on Game, Game Art, and Gamification, ICGGAG 2016
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The concept of Augmented Reality is a technology in which the interaction between the human-computer that can generate two-dimensional or three dimensional object in real time. Augmented reality can provide the necessary functions and information in its application. In this case the augmented reality (AR) just need a tool like a camera that can capture images by detecting the object without the marker coordinates from the surrounding environment to make real 3D objects. Augmented Reality application development is simple and easy to develop, so it can serve as a promotional tool or the provision of information. Therefore, the notion obtained separately develop AR applications that help the residence marketing department in the home market to show a 3D object of marketed house. So that prospective buyers get the information more interactive with real look 3D objects. This study use a software named Vuforia (QCAR) to implement augmented reality in mobile applications for marketing residence. Vuforia provides convenience to the Android mobile platform in the shooting in 3D objects. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: android; augmented reality; markerless; marketing residence; real environment; vuforia
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Application programs; Commerce; Human computer interaction; Marketing; Object detection; android; Augmented reality applications; Markerless; Marketing departments; Real environments; Surrounding environment; Three-dimensional object; vuforia; Augmented reality

Authors: Adrianto D., Luwinda F.A., Yesmaya V.
Title: Augmented Reality Implementation in Watch Catalog as e-Marketing Based on Mobile Aplication
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Luwinda, F.A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Augmented Reality is one of important methods to provide user with a better interactive user interface. In this research, Augmented Reality in Mobile Application will be applied to provide user with useful information related with Watch Catalogue. This research will be focused on design and implementation an application using Augmented Reality. The process model used in this research is Extreme Programming. Extreme Programming have a several steps which are planning, design, coding, and testing. The result of this research is Augmented Reality application based on Android. This research will be conclude that implementation of Augmented Reality based on Android in Watch Catalogue will help customer to collect the useful information related to the specific object of watch. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); User interfaces; Watches; Augmented reality applications; Design and implementations; E-marketing; EXtreme Programming; Interactive user interfaces; Mobile applications; Process Modeling; Augmented reality

Authors: Adrianto D., Yesmaya V., Chandra A.
Title: Increasing learning frequency through education based game
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adrianto, D., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chandra, A., Department of Computer Science, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: In the era of globalization, the development of the gaming world is evident very quickly, evidenced by the launch of various types of games every year, even every month. Game development that grows rapidly makes the desire to incorporate educational elements into the game application. It is also supported by the development of game engine to facilitate game development. The purpose of this research is to build an education based game on PC platform using Unity3D Game Engine (the newest game engine) to increase the learning frequency. The result achieved in this result is the creation of an educational based game app as a medium of study by combining the concept of the game and learning in it. Conclusion obtained after doing this research is that education based game can be made to increase the learning frequency. © 2015 Dennise Adrianto, Violitta Yesmaya and Alvin Chandra.
Author Keywords: Education based game; Game; Learning frequency; Unity3D
